授業目的: Designed in a seminar format, the objective of this course is for the students to conduct an independent research project on a topic of their choice and submit a research report that is equivalent to a master's thesis.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of the requirements for this course, students will be able to:
a) apply their knowledge and skill to identify a research problem, formulate research question, and develop the hypothesis;
b) conduct a critical review of the relevant literature and identify the research gap to focus on;
c) choose the appropriate theoretical and methodological framework and realistic research design for their proposed study;
d) collect and analyze the data using appropriate method and within the given time-frame; and
e) know the minimum contents of a research report and communicate the findings effectively and efficiently.
授業方法:
This course will be provided using "Online Format: Simultaneous and Two-way". Classes will be held at the time specified in the timetable via interactive live streaming using Zoom.
Study materials will be uploaded on LUNA. In the weekly sessions, we will discuss the progress of your research project. You are required to make presentation your research progress and also comment on other students' research projects.
In the last week, you have to present your final report.

トピック.授業外学習2:
As the formal classes are only to provide guidance to write the research report, students have to spend considerable amount of time to read reference books and journal articles to show their progress in each week.
On an average, the following is tentative schedule to complete the research project:
Finalizing research problem 2 weeks
Completing literature review 2 weeks
Reading research methodology 2 weeks
Data collection and analysis 4 weeks
Preliminary draft of the report 2 weeks
Final draft of the report 2 weeks
